- 2 -
6gQQ-SgOQ p.m.—Dinner Meeting,
Guest of honor and speaker—Dr, George D. Stoddard,
Dean, School of Education, New York University, and
Board of Directors of the Lincoln Center for the
Performing Arts, Inc. Dr. Stoddard will discuss the
relation of the Lincoln Center to the mass media.
*The meeting will end promptly so that theatre-goers
can make their curtains.
SUNDAY — SEPTEMBER 21, 195#
10s00 a.iru-12 noon—THIRD SESSION;
Themes The Potential for Improved Communications
between People and Nations by Radio/Television
1. 9The Role of the Broadcasting Foundation of America9—
Basil Thornton, Executive Director, B.F.A.
2. 9The Venezuelan ETV Experiment9 —
Dr. John Winne, State University of Iowa. (Tentative)
12 noon-lsQO p.m.—General bull session and round-up. Gripes,
suggestions, hopes, and plans—all welcome.
